intro: Triotosiphon gnoma, commonly known as the rock sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Triotosiphon gnoma is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
